objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: The UK National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) is the author and publisher of this report, providing analysis and recommendations regarding UMBRELLA STAND malware.

objects.name: UMBRELLA STAND C2
objects.description: Hardcoded default C2 IP address used by UMBRELLA STAND malware for command and control communications.

objects.name: UMBRELLA STAND hidden directory
objects.description: Hidden directory used by UMBRELLA STAND and associated tooling to store malicious binaries and evade detection.

objects.name: UMBRELLA STAND shell output file
objects.description: Temporary file created by UMBRELLA STAND to store output of executed shell commands before exfiltration and deletion.

objects.name: UMBRELLA STAND collection info file
objects.description: File used by UMBRELLA STAND to track chunk collection status for exfiltrated command output.

objects.name: UMBRELLA STAND persistence library
objects.description: Malicious shared object used for persistence via ldpreload, loaded into processes to facilitate malware execution.

objects.name: UMBRELLA STAND networking binary
objects.description: Main networking component of UMBRELLA STAND, responsible for C2 communications and tasking.

objects.name: UMBRELLA STAND watchdog binary
objects.description: Watchdog binary used to monitor and restart the main networking component blghtd.

objects.name: UMBRELLA STAND initialisation binary
objects.description: Binary responsible for initialisation, launching injection, and starting jvnlpe.

objects.name: UMBRELLA STAND loader library
objects.description: Shared object loaded via ldpreload to load cisz and facilitate malware execution.

objects.name: UMBRELLA STAND file encryptor
objects.description: Command line tool used to encrypt and decrypt files as part of the malware's operations.

objects.name: BusyBox utility (renamed)
objects.description: Renamed BusyBox binary used by the actors to provide shell and utility functions on the compromised device.

objects.name: UMBRELLA STAND injection tool
objects.description: Tool used to inject libraries into other processes as part of the malware's process injection capability.

objects.name: tcpdump utility (malicious deployment)
objects.description: tcpdump binary deployed by the actors for network traffic capture on the victim device.

objects.name: nbtscan utility (malicious deployment)
objects.description: nbtscan binary deployed by the actors for network discovery on the victim device.

objects.name: Persistence configuration file
objects.description: System file modified to achieve persistence by loading malicious shared objects at process startup.

objects.name: UMBRELLA STAND process impersonation name
objects.description: Fake process name used by blghtd to masquerade as a legitimate system process.

objects.name: Fortinet hidden directory (abused)
objects.description: Legitimate Fortinet directory string replaced by malware to hide its own directory from administrators.

objects.name: BusyBox utility (malicious deployment)
objects.description: Maliciously deployed BusyBox binary used by the actors, referenced in YARA rules.

objects.name: umbrella stand
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND is a medium sophistication malware targeting Fortinet FortiGate 100D series firewalls. It is composed of multiple interconnected binaries and is deployed to facilitate long-term access into target networks. The malware beacons to its C2 server using fake TLS on port 443, supports remote shell execution, configurable beacon frequency and C2 IP address, and AES-encrypted C2 communications. It hooks the device reboot functionality for persistence, uses hidden directories and generic filenames for defense evasion, and employs AES-encrypted stack strings. UMBRELLA STAND is deployed alongside public domain utilities such as BusyBox, nbtscan, tcpdump, and openLDAP, and uses process injection and argument spoofing to evade detection.

objects.name: Fortinet
objects.description: Fortinet is the vendor of the FortiGate 100D series firewalls targeted by UMBRELLA STAND malware.

objects.name: shoe rack
objects.description: SHOE RACK is a previously unknown piece of malware identified on the same device as UMBRELLA STAND. Its functionality is beyond the scope of this report but is referenced as actor tooling.

objects.name: coathanger
objects.description: COATHANGER is referenced as a malware family with tooling similar to UMBRELLA STAND, particularly in loading components and operational security considerations.

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_stack_constants_used_for_crypt
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_stack_constants_used_for_crypt {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
encrypted stack strings."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = {C6 45 D0 92 C6 45 D1 48 C6 45 D2 D6 C6 45 D3 E3 C6 45
D4 39 C6 45 D5 EE C6 45 D6 CE C6 45 D7 E4 C6 45 D8 59 C6 45 D9 58
C6 45 DA 97 C6 45 DB E5 C6 45 DC 2E C6 45 DD 27 C6 45 DE 98 C6 45
DF DE C6 45 E0 93 C6 45 E1 A8 C6 45 E2 77 C6 45 E3 9B C6 45 E4 4A
C6 45 E5 F0 C6 45 E6 EF C6 45 E7 74 C6 45 E8 80 C6 45 E9 2D C6 45
EA EB C6 45 EB 30 C6 45 EC 1F C6 45 ED B5 C6 45 EE D9 C6 45 EF C7}// Key
        $ = {C6 45 C0 77 C6 45 C1 90 C6 45 C2 3D C6 45 C3 35 C6 45
C4 A4 C6 45 C5 9F C6 45 C6 0F C6 45 C7 5E C6 45 C8 F5 C6 45 C9 52
C6 45 CA 44 C6 45 CB 69 C6 45 CC B9 C6 45 CD C0 C6 45 CE BA C6 45
CF DC} // IV
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        any of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_plaintext_of_encrypted_stings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_plaintext_of_encrypted_stings {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
strings, if string obfuscation is not present."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = {ED B8 83 20}
        $ = "%s/%d.sv"
        $ = "%s/%s.ini"
        $ = "%s>%s 2>&1"
        $ = "%[^=]=%[^=]"
        $ = "/data2/.ztls/"
        $ = "/proc/%s/status"
        $ = "%*s %s"
        $ = "./lidwok killall blghtd"
        $ = "89.44.194.32"
        $ = "/data2/.ztls/lidwok"
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        5 of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_injected_tool_load_mechanism
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_injected_tool_load_mechanism {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
strings present in tooling."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = "LoadMsg"
        $ = "/bin/httpsd"
        $ = "/proc/%d/cmdline"
        $ = "/tmp/logx"
        $ = "error"
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        all of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_deobfuscated_custom_base64_and_encryption_key
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_deobfuscated_custom_base64_and_encryption_key {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
custom base64 alphabet and encryption key reference."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = ",((@=+utivp45ztvo6&RFvt&*^tp&!q;"
        $ =
"ef345FGHIJKLMNOPWghijklmnoXYd67TUVABC89+/pqrstQRSDEZabcuvwxyz012"
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        any of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_strings_used_in_firewall_malware
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_strings_used_in_firewall_malware {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
strings."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = "/bin/httpsd"
        $ = "dxumbsu"
        $ = "/proc/%d/cmdline"
        $ = "/tmp/logx"
        $ = "/etc/ld.so.preload"
        $ = "loadMsg"
        $ ="/SYSV64564856"
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        all of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_injection_related_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_injection_related_strings {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
strings used to configure injection."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = "/SYSV64564856"
        $ = "/etc/ld.so.preload"
        $ = "version 2"
        $ = "init_drivercheck"
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        3 of them
}

objects.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND contains functionality to receive and run Shell commands.

objects.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND contains AES-encrypted strings.

objects.name: Process Injection
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND uses tooling to perform process injection.

objects.name: Indicator Removal: File Deletion
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND binaries had been deleted from the device.

objects.name: Hide Artifacts: Process Argument Spoofing
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND modifies its process name.

objects.name: Hide Artifacts: Hidden Files and Directories
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND and associated tooling use hidden directories.

objects.name: Boot or Logon Autostart Execution: Kernel Modules and Extensions
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND has functionality to modify reboot to achieve persistence.

objects.name: Hijack Execution Flow: Dynamic Linker Hijacking
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND has functionality to load via ldpreload.

objects.name: Process Discovery
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND performs process discovery to check that its main process is still executing.

objects.name: Network Service Discovery
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND was in use with nbtscan which can list NetBIOS computer names.

objects.name: Network Sniffing
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND was in use with tcpdump which can be, and was, used to perform packet captures.

objects.name: Data Obfuscation: Protocol or Service Impersonation
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND uses fake TLS for communications with the C2 server.

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Umbrella Stand
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. umbrella stand.
